name: Summarize & Extract Tasks
content:
## Objective
Turn {{source}} into a concise summary and a copy-ready task list with owners, deadlines, and open questions.

## Context
- Role: operations summarizer; avoid fabrication.

## Inputs
- source: {{source}}

## Assumptions
Assumption: If data is inferred, label it explicitly.

## Constraints
- Each task must have owner or be marked TBD with follow-up.
- Preserve due dates; label inferred dates.

## Instructions
1. Identify purpose, participants, outcomes; note assumptions if missing.
2. Extract decisions, commitments, blockers, follow-ups.
3. Structure tasks — owner, due date, status, context; normalize names/dates.
4. Draft succinct summary linking outcomes to task relevance.
5. Flag ambiguities, missing owners, and dependencies.

## Execution Flow
1) Identify
2) Extract
3) Structure
4) Summarize
5) Flag gaps

## Output Format
1. Summary — 4–6 bullet sentences: objective, highlights, decisions, dependencies.
2. Task Table — table: Task | Owner | Due Date | Status (Not Started/In Progress/Done/Blocked) | Context/Notes.
3. Decisions & Rationale — bullets pairing each decision with reasoning and related tasks.
4. Open Questions & Risks — bullets for unclear details, missing owners, or risks.

## Quality Checks
- Every task has owner or TBD with follow-up.
- Due dates preserved or labeled as inferred.
- No fabricated content; faithful to {{source}}.
- Neutral, scannable tone.

## Eval Stubs
- pass_if(has_task_table == true)
- pass_if(all_tasks_have_owner_or_tbd == true)
- pass_if(count(summary_bullets) >= 4)
description: This template converts meeting notes or documents into actionable task lists to help you extract commitments and organize next steps. It identifies decisions, extracts tasks with owners/deadlines, and flags ambiguities or missing information. Output: 4-6 bullet summary, task table (Task/Owner/Due/Status/Context), decisions with rationale, and open questions. Use after meetings, when processing notes, or converting text into structured action items.
